articles.headline: Twitter Bars Alex Jones and Infowars, Citing Harassing Messages
articles.snippet: When Facebook and YouTube booted Mr. Jones, the internet provocateur, last month, Twitter did not. On Thursday, it joined them.
articles.abstract: When Facebook and YouTube booted Mr. Jones, the internet provocateur, last month, Twitter did not. On Thursday, it joined them.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple, Facebook and Google’s YouTube mostly barred Alex Jones, the right-wing provocateur and creator of the conspiracy theorist website Infowars, last month for propagating hate speech. Twitter did not.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger and Jack Nicas

articles.headline: Les Moonves Said to Be Negotiating Possible Exit From CBS
articles.snippet: Mr. Moonves, who is facing allegations of sexual harassment and a battle for control of the network, is said to be talking to the board about his possible departure.
articles.abstract: Mr. Moonves, who is facing allegations of sexual harassment and a battle for control of the network, is said to be talking to the board about his possible departure.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leslie Moonves, faced with an investigation into allegations of sexual harassment against him as well as a bitter boardroom battle over the control of CBS, has for the last few weeks been negotiating his potential exit from the network he has run for two decades.

articles.headline: Newly Revealed Emails Raise Fresh Objections to Kavanaugh Confirmation
articles.snippet: Democrats pressed Judge Kavanaugh to explain fresh disclosures on abortion rights, affirmative action and previous testimony to the Senate.
articles.abstract: Democrats pressed Judge Kavanaugh to explain fresh disclosures on abortion rights, affirmative action and previous testimony to the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The disclosure on Thursday of dozens of previously secret emails involving Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh provoked pointed new questions on the third day of his Supreme Court confirmation hearings, as Democrats pressed him to explain fresh disclosures on abortion rights, affirmative action and previous testimony to the Senate.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

articles.headline: In a Sign of the Economy’s Strength, Jobs and Wages Moved Higher in August
articles.snippet: The largely positive Labor Department report hinted that tariffs could be starting to take a toll on manufacturing jobs.
articles.abstract: The largely positive Labor Department report hinted that tariffs could be starting to take a toll on manufacturing jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American economy’s stamina was showcased Friday as the government reported that wages in August sprinted forward at their fastest pace since the recession ended and that the job creation streak extended to 95 months.

articles.headline: The Mystery of Amazon HQ2 Has Finalists Seeing Clues Everywhere
articles.snippet: Amazon announced its plans for a second headquarters a year ago on Friday. People in the 20 finalist cities are looking for any sign of a winner.
articles.abstract: Amazon announced its plans for a second headquarters a year ago on Friday. People in the 20 finalist cities are looking for any sign of a winner.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over Labor Day weekend, a club promoter who goes by the name Purple posted a photo on Instagram from the LIV nightclub in Miami. In front of a wall graffitied with names and a single “Life Is Beautiful” sticker, Purple’s arm was casually draped over the shoulders of Jeff Bezos, the Amazon chief executive, whose pants matched the host’s name.

articles.headline: Tesla Shaken by a Departure and What Elon Musk Was Smoking
articles.snippet: The head of accounting departed weeks after he arrived, and the company’s chief held forth in a webcast punctuated by his apparent puffs on a joint.
articles.abstract: The head of accounting departed weeks after he arrived, and the company’s chief held forth in a webcast punctuated by his apparent puffs on a joint.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a moment, it looked as if Elon Musk and Tesla had put a summer of turbulence behind them. The moment was very brief.

articles.headline: Amazon’s Antitrust Antagonist Has a Breakthrough Idea
articles.snippet: With a single scholarly article, Lina Khan, 29, has reframed decades of monopoly law.
articles.abstract: With a single scholarly article, Lina Khan, 29, has reframed decades of monopoly law.
articles.lead_paragraph: The dead books are on the top floor of Southern Methodist University’s law library.
